title: Mercy: Chris Pratt on being locked into an executioner's chair for new film
description: The Marvel star plays a detective with 90 minutes to prove to an AI judge he did not murder his wife.
content:
Being locked barefoot in an executioner's chair sounds uncomfortable, but that is what Chris Pratt requested for his latest film, Mercy.
More familiar as a wisecracking action hero in blockbusters like Guardians of the Galaxy and Jurassic World, this... [3572 chars]

title: Greenland 'will stay Greenland', former Trump adviser declares
description: Donald Trump's former chief economic adviser said the US president's actions are a negotiating tactic.
content:
Donald Trump will not be able to force Greenland to change ownership, a former top adviser to the US president has told the BBC.
IBM's vice chairman Gary Cohn, who advised Trump on the economy in his first term, said "Greenland will stay Greenland" a... [4485 chars]

title: Are 'tech dense' farms the future of farming?
description: A host of technology is on offer to farmers, promising to raise farming yields and lower food prices.
content:
Jake Leguee is a third-generation farmer in Saskatchewan, Canada.
Since his grandfather bought the 17,000 acres in 1956, the Leguee family has grown canola, wheat, flax and green lentils.
As a child, he watched his father and grandfather spending hou... [3447 chars]

title: UK ministers launch consultation on whether to ban social media for under-16s
description: Move comes as peers prepare to vote on an amendment to a bill that would enact a ban within a year of the bill passing
content:
Ministers have launched a consultation into whether to ban under-16s from using social media as part of a package of measures designed to curb mobile phone use among young people.
Liz Kendall, the technology secretary, announced the consultation on M... [4399 chars]

title: Voter Voices: US voters evaluate Trump's economy after year one
description: We asked six Americans what they make of the US economy one year after President Trump returned to the White House.
content:
When campaigning to become president for the second time, Donald Trump made improving the economy a central part of his pitch to voters.
One year after returning to the White House, we asked voters about that promise. What do they think of the state ... [4411 chars]
